items.message:
Flooding is possible in this area.

Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.

Lane.

This message will be updated by 09:00 AM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Whitewater Bridge river gauge as a result of Storm Babet.  Consequently, the risk of flooding remains.  
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around Mansfield, the Sherwood Forest Caravan Park at Clipstone, Edwinstowe, Ollerton, Whitewater Lane at Whitewater Bridge and West Drayton.   
Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 20/10/23, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Black Brook, Coppice Brook, Markeaton Brook, Chaddeston Brook, Wilne Drain, Cuttle Brook, Doles Brook, Ramsley Brook and Carr Brook

items.message:
"River levels are forecast to rise at the Draycott Rain gauge as a result of Storm BABET.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from 19:00, tonight 19/10/23. 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around the tributaries to the River Derwent and River Trent in South Derbyshire, including Black Brook, Coppice Brook, Markeaton Brook, Chaddeston Brook, Wilne Drain, Cuttle Brook, Doles Brook, Ramsley Brook and Carr Brook. 
Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  River levels will continue to rise over the weekend.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area and liaising with emergency services. 
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 09:00 on 20/10/23, or as the situation changes."

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise on the upper river Swale due to overnight rainfall associated with Storm Babet.

Flooding is possible on low lying land around the river Swale and tributaries. Confidence of locations most at risk is currently low. We will update this message as details become clear.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.

Further heavy rainfall is forecast throughout Friday, 20/10/2023. We are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated by 1:00 PM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise on the upper River Esk due to overnight rainfall associated with Storm Babet.

Flooding is possible on low lying land near the river Esk and tributaries. Confidence of locations most at risk is currently low. We will update this message as details become clear.

Further heavy rainfall is forecast throughout Friday, 20/10/2023.

Our incident room is open and we are closely monitoring the situation.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.

This message will be updated by 1:00 PM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

Flood alert area: Low lying land in the Esk Valley and some minor roads.

River levels are forecast to rise on the river Seven due to rainfall associated with Storm Babet.

Flooding is possible on low lying land around the river Seven and tributaries, particularly in the Sinnington to Normanby area.

Further heavy rainfall is forecast throughout Friday, 20/10/2023.

Our incident room is open and we are closely monitoring the situation

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.

This message will be updated by 08:00 AM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

Flood alert area: Land around the River Seven and it's tributaries including Northdale Beck, Hartoft Beck, Ings Beck, Lastingham Beck, Sutherland Beck, Cropton Beck, Catter Beck, including properties in Sinnington and to the East of Normanby.

River levels are forecast to rise on the Rivers Pont and Blyth due to heavy rainfall caused by Storm Babet. 

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Rivers Pont and Blyth from 03:15AM on 20/10/2023, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around Rivers Pont and Blyth and their tributaries. 

Further heavy rainfall is forecast throughout Friday and Saturday. 

We will continue to monitor levels closely and may issue flood warnings if required. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise on the Upper River Coquet due to heavy rainfall caused by Storm Babet. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper River Coquet from 07:30AM on 20/10/2023, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around riverside footpaths and low lying land and roads. 

Further heavy rainfall is forecast throughout Friday and Saturday. 

Rothbury flood gates will be closing at 8:00AM on 20/10/2023. We will continue to monitor levels closely and may issue flood warnings if required. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise on the River Wansbeck due to heavy rainfall caused by Storm Babet. 

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Wansbeck from 07:00AM on 20/10/2023 with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around riverside footpaths and low lying land and roads. 

Further heavy rainfall is forecast throughout Friday and Saturday.  

We will continue to monitor levels closely and may issue flood warnings if required.  

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. Properties at Wansbeck Street in Morpeth should operate their property level protection now. 

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Storm Babet is forecast to bring strong winds, large waves and spray overtopping on the coast. 

Areas most at risk include beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads. Waves are forecast to overtop coastal defences at beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads .
Highest tide level is expected from 06:00 AM to 09:00AM on 20/10/2023. 

Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.

We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including tidal River Esk
items.message:
Storm Babet is forecast to produce large waves and spray overtopping on the coast tomorrow morning.
Flooding is possible at The North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including Sandsend and the tidal River Esk between 05:00 AM and 11:30 AM on 20/10/2023.

We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next 3 days and as a result we may issue further alerts for subsequent tides on Friday and Saturday.
Our incident rooms are open, and we are closely monitoring the situation.

Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
This message will be updated by 05:00 AM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Maun at Haughton, Milton and West Drayton
items.message:
River levels have fallen below the flood warning threshold but will rise again by tomorrow early morning at the Whitewater Bridge river gauge as a result of Storm Babet.  
Consequently, the risk of flooding remains.  Areas most at risk are Haughton, Milton and West Drayton.   
Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 20/10/23, or as the situation changes

Storm Babet is forecast to produce large waves and spray overtopping on the coast tomorrow morning (20/10/20203)

Areas most at risk include The North Sea coast from Bridlington to Barmston, particularly in Bridlington around North and South Piers and the areas around the Lifeboat Station and Harbour. From 04:00 AM on 20/10/2023, overtopping waves and spray could affect these areas throughout Friday and into Saturday.

We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next 3 days and as a result we may issue further alerts for subsequent tides on Friday and Saturday.

Our incident room is open and we are closely monitoring the situation.

Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.

This message will be updated by 1:00 PM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane, and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane
Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  River levels will continue to rise over the weekend.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area and liaising with emergency services. 
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

items.description: Tyne estuary at North Shields, South Shields and Howdon Pans
items.message:
Storm Babet is forecast to bring strong winds, large waves and spray overtopping on the coast. This Flood Warning has been issued due to the high tide forecast between 06:00 AM and 09:00 AM on 20/10/2023.

Areas most at risk include Properties at Fish Market, Bell Street, Dolphin Quay, Union Quay, Clive Street, Duke Street, Liddell Street, Corporation Quay, South Shields Ferry Landing, Wapping Street, Tyne Dock, Albert Edward Dock, Tyne Foyboatmen Association and Howdon Pans.

We will continue to monitor levels closely. Please stay away from beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as the expected large waves and sea spray will be dangerous. 

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

Storm Babet is forecast to produce large waves and spray overtopping on the coast tomorrow morning.
Areas most at risk include The sea front (A174) and properties adjacent to the road between 05:30 AM and 11:00 AM on 20/10/2023.

We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next 3 days and as a result we may issue further warnings for subsequent tides on Friday and Saturday.
Our incident rooms are open, and we are closely monitoring the situation.

Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
This message will be updated by 05:00 AM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise on the upper River Nidd due to overnight rainfall associated with Storm Babet.

Further heavy rainfall is forecast throughout Friday, 20/10/2023.

Our incident room is open and we are closely monitoring the situation.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.

items.description: River Devon and Smite in Leicestershire and Nottinghamshire
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Colston Bassett river gauge, as a result of Storm BABET. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from 19:00, tonight 19/10/23       
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads along the River Smite. Church Gate and Bunnison Lane in Colston Bassett could be impassable, with potentially dangerous depths of flood water.  Areas around the River Devon could also be affected at Easthorpe, Bottesford, Belvoir Lane and the Woolsthorpe to Belvoir road in Woolsthorpe, Church Lane and Main Street in Muston.   
Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours. River levels will continue to rise over the weekend.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area and liaising with emergency services. 
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 09:00 on 20/10/23, or as the situation changes.
